alert.note: Alert for Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 5:14AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A short period of light snow and or freezing drizzle is expected over the colder wind protected valleys of Chouteau County this morning... An area of spotty light rain, snow, and some freezing drizzle will pass through Chouteau County over the next hour or so. Light snow and or freezing drizzle will be limited to the colder wind protected valleys including the Fort Benton area and other locations along US highway 87 to the north. Liquid equivalent precipitation amounts will generally range from trace amounts to a couple hundreths of an inch. This may cause a light glaze of ice to develop on sub- freezing roads, sidewalks, and other exposed surfaces. Anyone traveling should be prepared for the development of potential icy spots on area roadways and pedestrians should also watch for slippery sidewalks.
